titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 232
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil (in lower left corner on folios with full-page miniatures), 1-137. Some folio numbers appear to have been corrected.

p.note: Top of page, in black ink by an modern hand: Drottningholms Bibl. Kat. no 96; below, in the same hand, the date 8/20 1854. Centre of page, in black ink by a different modern hand, a tally of the ornamental elements: 136 skrifna blad 15 taflor med hela ramar och stora initialer 10 mindre ramstycken och 10 initialer 182 mindre initialer 826 små initialer 62 små rankor. Bottom of page, in pencil by a modern hand: Tillhör KB.

binding.p: 18th-century binding. Red leather over cardboard. 4 double raised bands and endbands. , stamped in gold at the centre: the coat of arms of Queen Lovisa Ulrika of Sweden. , stamped in gold: MANUSCRIPT; below, A 232.

origin.p: France Clermont , 15th century, second half. The inclusion in the calendar of the feast of the Transfiguration (), instituted in 1457, gives a terminus post quem for the date of the manuscript. The inclusion of a large number of bishops, prelates, and martyrs of Clermont (e.g. Austremonius, Antholianus, Trigidius, Bonitus, Genesius, as well as Agricola and Vitalis) points to this as the place of origin. A former librarian notes, however, that the miniatures are of Flemish style.

provenance.p: The manuscript belonged to Lovisa Ulrika, Queen of Sweden 1751-1771 (her coat of arms on ). No 96 in the library catalogue of Drottningholm Palace.

acquisition.p: Transferred to the Royal Library in .

note.p: : translation of St William of Bourges (7 May);
: translation of Agricola and Vitalis (27 Nov.);
: the ascender of the d in Benedicti is embellished with a scroll.
: St Romanus is placed on August 8 rather than 9, and for the remainder of August, the feasts are early by one day (or two) compared to the common dates.

msItem.title: Hours of the Virgin (part I, Matins and Lauds)
msItem.incipit: DOmine labia mea aperies Antiphona Aue maria gracia plena
msItem.explicit: a presenti libari tristicia et eterna perfrui leticia Per dominum

msItem.title: Suffrages
msItem.incipit: Accipite spiritum sanctum quorum remiseritis peccata

msItem.title: Hours of the Virgin (part II, Prime to Compline)
msItem.incipit: DEus in adiutorium Psalmus DEus in nomine tuo saluum me fac
msItem.explicit: Graciam tuam quesumus domine ut supra

msItem.title: Hours of the Virgin (Advent)
msItem.rubric: Incipit officium beate marie in aduentu domini vt sequitur officium
msItem.incipit: DOmine labia mea aperies Vitatorium Regem uenturum dominum venite adoremus
msItem.explicit: perfecta sunt omnia que data sunt a domino Hodie

msItem.title: Hours of the Virgin (Christmas)
msItem.incipit: DOmine labia mea aperies Vitatorium Christus natus est nobis
msItem.explicit: ueritatis lumen ostende Qui tecum uiuit et regnat

msItem.title: Office for the dead
msItem.incipit: REgem cui omnia viuunt Venite adoremus
msItem.explicit: sanctorum tuorum iubeas esse consortes Per dominum

msItem.title: Litany
msItem.explicit: pro tui nominis misericorditer liberemur Per dominum nostrum

msItem.title: Hours of the Cross
msItem.incipit: DOmine labia mea aperies Hymnus PAtris sapiencia ueritas diuina
msItem.explicit: sis mihi solacium in mortis agone Deo gloria

msItem.title: Hours of the Holy Spirit
msItem.incipit: DOmine labia mea aperies NObis sancti spiritus gracia
msItem.explicit: et me eterna illumines inspiracione amen

note.p: Following immediately after the last prayer is an addition of 7 lines which appears to pertain to the next item, Hours of the Trinity; it begins, Pater noster Incipit officium de trinitate Ave maria.

msItem.title: Hours of the Trinity
msItem.incipit: DOmine labia mea aperies Hymnus Quicumque uult animam firmiter saluare
msItem.explicit: faciat me credere hoc cum firmitate antiphona Te iure ut supra Oracio ut supra

msItem.title: Common of martyrs
msItem.note: : miniature; the stoning of St Stephen.

msItem.title: Common of confessors
msItem.explicit: Letamini in domino etc Quem ibi defficiencia supra in ntli communi plurimorum martirum

msItem.title: Common of virgins
msItem.explicit: Sub tuum presidium confugimus dei genitris uirgo nostras deprecaciones Psalmus Dominus regnauit cum aliis (?)
msItem.note: Two leaves missing between and resulting in loss of text.

msItem.title: Readings for the Annunciation
msItem.explicit: ad resurrectionis glorias perducamur Per dominus

note.p: Seven readings excerpted from Jerome's letter no. IX to Paula and Eustochium followed by a postcommunio for the Annunciation.
: the Virgin Mary with the Christ Child and two angels.

msItem.title: Obsecro te
msItem.explicit: et exaudi domina dulcissima uirgo maria mater dei et misericordie Amen

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.incipit: OMnipotens sempiterne deus qui gloriose semperque virginis marie corpus
msItem.explicit: a morte subbitanea liberemur Per dominum nostrum ihesum christum filium tuum Qui tecum vivit et

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.incipit: GRaciam tuam quesumus domine mentibus nostris
msItem.explicit: ad resurectionis gloriam perducamur Per dominum nostrum

supportDesc.condition: Occasional stains throughout the manuscript, e.g. (possibly water damage). : imprint from a circular object. : stain; text smudged.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink; rubrics in red; capitals touched in red.

decoNote.p: , : decorated initial over 5 lines, one in red, one in blue, with foliate patterns in gold on a blue or red background outlined in black and floral patterns in gold paint on the background and in the counter space.

, , , , , : illuminated foliate initial over 4-5 lines in blue and red with patterns in white and outlined in black on a background of gold leaf outlined in black and vine stems with leaves in red, blue and mauve in the counter space.

, , , , , , : illuminated foliate initial over 4-5 lines in blue and red with patterns in white and outlined in black on a background of gold leaf outlined in black and floral motifs in the same style as the border decoration on an ochre background in the counter space.
: plain text initials over 2-3 lines in gold paint on a square background outlined in black and floral patterns in gold paint in the counter space.
: plain sentence initials over 1 line in gold paint on a square background outlined in black and floral patterns in gold paint in the counter space. Line fillers in the same style.
: Two booksmarks of woven green silk thread.
